Posts.Content: Lulu34 wrote: hi there is anybody else on ganetespib? Im on the ENCHANT trial for TNBC and HER2+..... Im in the TNBC arm. I started my second cycle last week... I think theres only around 60 in the trial and im the only one in scotland so desperately seeking a fellow pioneer AKA guinea pig and would love to share experiences with somebody else. Pretty lonely out here in ENCHANT land Lulu x Gd1 stg1 IDC apr2006 WLE SNB0/2 Rads x25 Tamox 5yrs, Let 7mths. Gd3 stg1 TNBC may2009 WLE SNB 0/2 E-CMFx8 Rads x25. Gd3 stg3 TNBC LN recurr aug2011 WLE ANC 2/9 tax&carbo x6 Rads x20. Stg4 lung mets + LN recurr aug2013 ganetespib x18. BRCA2+ jan2010 Dx 4/17/2006, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Surgery 5/4/2006 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Surgery 5/21/2006 Lumpectomy: Right Hormonal Therapy 5/31/2006 Radiation Therapy 7/13/2006 Breast Dx 5/14/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 5/20/2009 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Chemotherapy 6/24/2009 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Ellence (epirubicin), Fluorouracil (5-fluorouracil, 5-FU, Adrucil), Methotrexate (Amethopterin, Mexate, Folex) Radiation Therapy 1/8/2010 Breast Hormonal Therapy 4/9/2010 Surgery 9/13/2010 Prophylactic ovary removal Dx 8/23/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 2/9 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 9/13/2011 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 10/16/2011 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 3/1/2012 Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 3/16/2012 Hormonal Therapy 2/18/2013 Femara (letrozole) Dx 8/23/2013, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Desperately seeking Ganetespib trialers! Lulu34 Lulu34

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2013 09:18PM Lulu34 wrote: i was so excited hen i saw somebody replied thinking you were on it LOL But think my elusive chemo buddy is gonna take a while to find as so few folk are on it. Iv not been on it long... Having my 3rd infusion of 6 of my second cycle 6 (2 infusions a week then 1 week off). Had a pet scan before starting and a repeat pet after 1 cycle and disease was stable. Which is excellent and now being monitored by CT and have my first on friday and then every 6 weeks and can stay on trial as long as treatment works. Thanks for replying and taking interest in my post Lulu x
Posts.Title: Desperately seeking Ganetespib trialers! Lulu34 Lulu34

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2012 05:04PM Lulu34 wrote: Hi MMM i have positive rotters nodes following a recurrence of TNBC back in august.... i was told its not as bad as SCL nodes, but my onc thinks its more serious than auxilary nodes.... my aux nodes were negative at both my original diagnosis and at the recurrence but had 2 rotters nodes affected 15mm and 7mm. my breast surgeon said he would consider it as stage 2 disease but onc says stage 3... hes given my prognosis as good... 80% survival at 10 years.
